message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.GR 

This paper proposes a novel optical flow estimation framework that utilizes a multi-scale generalized plane matching approach. The method involves detecting robust plane models and iteratively applying a plane matching scheme within a multi-scale framework. This approach is relevant to computer vision (cs.CV) as it deals with image analysis and processing. Additionally, the use of planes and motion compensation is relevant to robotics (cs.RO) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) as it involves understanding the structure of the environment and predicting motion. The iterative and multi-scale nature of the method also suggests relevance to machine learning (cs.LG) and graphics (cs.GR) as it involves optimizing a model and generating visual outputs.
